February 24, 2013: Fiction
GONE GIRL, by Gillian Flynn. (Crown, $25.) A woman disappears on her fifth
anniversary; is her husband a killer?
TENTH OF DECEMBER, by George Saunders. (Random House, $26.) Stories that
take on the big questions.
A MEMORY OF LIGHT, by Robert Jordan and Brandon Sanderson. (Tor/Tom
Doherty, $34.99.) The 14th and final novel in the Wheel of Time fantasy series.
TOUCH AND GO, by Lisa Gardner. (Dutton, $26.95.) An investigator probing the
disappearance of a seemingly perfect Boston family must dig beneath the surface.
PRIVATE BERLIN, by James Patterson and Mark Sullivan. (Little, Brown &
Company, $27.99.) A superstar agent at the German headquarters of an
investigation firm disappears.
UNTIL THE END OF TIME, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $28.) The stories of two
relationships, at different times, intersect unexpectedly.
SUSPECT, by Robert Crais. (Putnam, $27.95.) A Los Angeles policeman and a
German shepherd, both suffering from PTSD, search for the killers of the cop’s
partner.
A DEEPER LOVE INSIDE, by Sister Souljah. (Atria/Emily Bestler Books, $26.99.) A
sequel to “The Coldest Winter Ever” focuses on Winter’s younger sister, Porsche
Santiaga.
THE TWELVE TRIBES OF HATTIE, by Ayana Mathis. (Knopf, $24.95.) Fifty-some
years in the life of an African-American family whose matriarch arrives in
Philadelphia in 1923.
THE FIFTH ASSASSIN, by Brad Meltzer. (Grand Central, $27.99.) Beecher White
tracks an assassin who is recreating the crimes of the four men who murdered
presidents.
THE RACKETEER, by John Grisham. (Doubleday, $28.95.) An imprisoned ex-
lawyer schemes to exchange information about a murdered federal judge for his
freedom.
DEADLY STAKES, by J. A. Jance. (Touchstone, $25.99.) Ali Reynolds must
determine whether two crimes in Arizona are related in order to stop the killer.
INSANE CITY, by Dave Barry. (Putnam, $26.95.) The run-up to a glamorous
wedding involves pranks, criminals, high-speed chases, exotic animals and other
mayhem.
THE THIRD BULLET, by Stephen Hunter. (Simon & Schuster, $26.99.) The veteran
February 24, 2013
Non-Fiction
MY BELOVED WORLD, by Sonia Sotomayor. (Knopf, $27.95.) The Supreme
Court justice recalls growing up in the Bronx, attending Princeton and becoming a
federal judge.
AMERICAN SNIPER, by Chris Kyle with Scott McEwen and Jim DeFelice.
(Morrow/HarperCollins, $26.99.) A member of the Navy SEALs discusses his
childhood, marriage and battlefield experiences.
KILLING KENNEDY, by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard. (Holt, $28.) The host of
“The O’Reilly Factor” recounts the events surrounding the assassination of John F.
Kennedy.
THE FUTURE, by Al Gore. (Random House, $30.) The six drivers of global
change that are reshaping our world.
GOING CLEAR, by Lawrence Wright. (Knopf, $28.95.) The Pulitzer Prize-winning
author examines the world of Scientology.
FRANCONA, by Terry Francona and Dan Shaughnessy. (Houghton Mifflin
Harcourt, $28.) The manager’s Red Sox years.
KILLING LINCOLN, by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard. (Holt, $28.) The host of
"The O'Reilly Factor" recounts the events surrounding the assassination of
Abraham Lincoln.
NO EASY DAY, by Mark Owen with Kevin Maurer. (Dutton, $26.95.) An account
by a former member of the Navy SEALs, written pseudonymously, of the mission
that killed bin Laden.
REMEMBERING WHITNEY, by Cissy Houston with Lisa Dickey.
(Harper/HarperCollins, $27.99.) The gospel singer discusses her daughter
Whitney’s life.
BEYOND BELIEF, by Jenna Miscavige Hill with Lisa Pulitzer.
(Morrow/HarperCollins, $27.99.) How the niece of the Scientology leader David
Miscavige left the church at 21.
THOMAS JEFFERSON, by Jon Meacham. (Random House, $35.) The Pulitzer
Prize-winning biographer celebrates Jefferson’s skills as a practical politician.
UNBROKEN, by Laura Hillenbrand. (Random House, $27.) An Olympic runner's
story of survival as a prisoner of the Japanese in World War II.
THE THEORETICAL MINIMUM, by Leonard Susskind and George Hrabovsky.
(Basic Books.) An introduction to physics for the amateur.
